Title: [Updated] Drilling Engineering and Technical Services Market Size Analysis | Jereh Oilfield Services Group, ZPEC ... - economica.ma
Summary: The report provides comprehensive insights and intelligence on the global Drilling Engineering and Technical Services market from 2024 to 2031. It includes analysis of pricing, geographical regions, technology, supply and demand dynamics, and competitive landscape. The market is segmented by type (offshore, onshore) and application (oil, natural gas, other), with top players like Jereh Oilfield Services Group, ZPEC, Sinopec, and Schlumberger. The report aims to facilitate sustainable growth for clients through thorough analysis and recommendations, including SWOT analysis and investment feasibility.

Title: Natural Gas Futures Drift Lower After Light EIA Storage Print; Cash Weaker — MidDay Market Snapshot - Natural Gas Intelligence
Summary: August natural gas futures experienced a seventh straight loss, trading lower after an in-line weekly storage injection report from the EIA. The storage build was seasonally light at 32 Bcf, but a bearish revision to the previous week's data contributed to the decline. Factors influencing the market include natural gas prices, LNG demand, and storage levels.

Title: Natural Gas Futures Extend Losses as Forecasts Suggest Demand Risks While Production Rises - Natural Gas Intelligence
Summary: Higher production and lower demand outlooks led to further losses for August Nymex natural gas futures. Weather forecasts indicated a reduction in heat for later in July, and the formation of the earliest Category 5 hurricane on record also impacted market sentiment. The report highlights factors such as production levels, weather impacts, and LNG demand affecting natural gas prices.

Title: Selling Continues for Natural Gas Futures; California Cash Down Sharply Despite Heat — MidDay Market Snapshot - Natural Gas Intelligence
Summary: August natural gas futures saw a sixth consecutive decline, pressured by cooler weather forecasts and weaker cash prices. A federal court in Louisiana ordered the DOE to lift the LNG permit pause, which influenced the back of the curve. Market dynamics are affected by NYMEX prices, natural gas futures, and LNG infrastructure developments.

Title: US natural gas prices fall - Markets - Business Recorder
Summary: US natural gas futures remained near a seven-week low as the market awaited direction from a federal report expected to show a smaller-than-usual storage build. Despite a heat wave driving electricity demand, rising output and oversupply in storage contributed to the price decline. Market participants forecast a storage build of 32 Bcf, significantly lower than the previous year's and five-year average increases.

Title: August Natural Gas Futures Dragged Below $2.500 Amid Higher Production, Milder Weather Forecasts — MidDay ... - Natural Gas Intelligence
Summary: August natural gas futures fell below key support levels due to milder weather forecasts and increased Lower 48 gas production. The report discusses the impact of higher production, weather forecasts, and Hurricane Beryl on natural gas prices. Market conditions include production data, pipeline developments, and LNG terminal operations.

Title: Rystad Energy: Bullish market fundamentals are the main contributing factor to higher global oil prices - World Pipelines
Summary: Rystad Energy's analysis indicates strong market fundamentals driving higher oil prices, with lower crude exports from OPEC and Russia contributing to a tighter market. The report suggests that better-than-expected market fundamentals and forthcoming US interest rate cuts are supporting the bullish trajectory. Adjustments in US oil production forecasts, particularly in the Permian Basin, and compliance with OPEC+ production cuts are also highlighted.

Title: Asia's first half crude oil imports slip, undermining bullish forecasts - Reuters
Summary: Asia's crude oil imports for the first half of the year declined, challenging bullish market forecasts. The report discusses the impact of lower imports on global oil prices and market expectations. Factors influencing the market include trade dynamics, regional demand, and geopolitical developments.
